ch.fhnw.imvs.smartcard

Class TLV

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.fhnw.imvs.smartcard.TLV

  • public final class TLV
extends java.lang.Object
    Immutable class representing a BERTLV-Formatted message. The constructor takes a bytearray, reads the data to fill the fields of this class and recursively create children as necessary.
    Author:
    Christof Arnosti (christof.arnosti@fhnw.ch)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TLV

        public TLV(byte[] data)
        Default Constructor. Tries to construct a TLV Object out of the data, starting with byte 0 until the end.
        Parameters:
        data - bytearray of TLV-Encoded Data

      • TLV

        public TLV(byte[] data,
   int offset)
        This constructor returns a TLV-Object representing the TLV-Formatted message at position offset in the data -bytearray.
        Parameters:
        data - Bytearray containing the TLV-Coded message.
        offset - Start of the TLV-Formatted message in the data-bytearray.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If data

        private int getValueLength()
        Returns the length of the value of this TLV as reported in the TLV header.
        Returns:

        public byte[] getContent()

        copy of the content.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this TLV has children

      • getContentDescription

      • getChildByNumber

        public TLV getChildByNumber(int number)
        Get a child of the current TLV by the index, ordered by their occurence in the original bytearray.
        Parameters:
        number - The Index of the child.
        Returns:
        The child TLV.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this method was called on a TLV without children.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index of the child is invalid.

      • getChildByTag

        public TLV getChildByTag(byte[] header)
        Get a specific child of this TLV, identified by its Type.
        Parameters:
        header - A bytearray containing the type to search for.
        Returns:
        Specific child of the current TLV if the type matches the parameter, null otherwise
